conclusion: Analyze the process depicted in the p-V diagram to find work done from state B to C.
The process from B to C is a horizontal line on the p-V diagram, indicating an isobaric process.
Work done by the gas during an isobaric process can be calculated using the formula W = P ΔV.
Pressure at state B (and C) is 2 x 10^5 Pa.
Volume at state B is 2 x 10^-3 m^3 and volume at state C is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate the change in volume ΔV = V_C - V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate the work done W = P ΔV = 200 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state B to state C is 200 J.
